name: Gulab Jamun
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine milk powder, all-purpose flour, and baking soda.
Add ghee and mix well.
Slowly add milk to form a soft dough.
Shape the dough into small balls.

name: Paayasam
instructions: Wash the rice and soak it in water for 15 minutes.
In a heavy-bottomed pan, bring the milk to a boil.
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the boiling milk. Cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked and the milk thickens, stirring occasionally.
Add sugar and continue cooking until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture thickens further.
In a separate pan, heat ghee and fry the cashew nuts and raisins until golden brown. Add them to the paayasam.
Add cardamom powder and saffron strands. Mix well.
Remove from heat and let it rest for 15 minutes before serving.

name: Bobbatlu
instructions: Soak chana dal in water for 2 hours. Drain the water.
Pressure cook chana dal with enough water until soft. Drain excess water.
Add jaggery to a pan with a little water and heat until it melts. Add cooked chana dal, cardamom powder, and mix well. Cook until the mixture thickens. Let it cool.
In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, turmeric powder, salt, and water to make a smooth dough.
Divide the dough into small balls. Roll out each ball into a small circle. Place a spoonful of the chana dal mixture in the center and seal the edges to form a ball.
Flatten the ball gently and roll it out into a circle.
Heat a griddle and cook the bobbatlu on both sides using ghee until golden brown.
Serve hot or warm.

name: Double Ka Meetha
instructions: Trim the edges of the bread slices and cut them into halves diagonally.
Heat ghee in a pan and fry the bread slices until golden brown. Set aside.
In the same pan, add milk and bring it to a boil. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands. Mix well and cook until the sugar dissolves.
Place the fried bread slices in the milk mixture and let them soak for a few minutes.
Garnish with fried cashew nuts, almonds, and raisins.
Let it cool for 15 minutes before serving.

name: Vegetable Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Add carrots, celery, potato, green beans, and corn. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour in vegetable broth and diced tomatoes. Season with dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Serve hot.

name: Tomato Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, and sauté until softened.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they start to break down, about 10 minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes.
Using an immersion blender, blend the soup until smooth. Alternatively, let the soup cool slightly and blend it in batches in a blender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in fresh basil leaves.
If using heavy cream, stir it in until well combined. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, then remove from heat.
Serve hot, garnished with additional fresh basil leaves if desired.

name: Corn Soup
instructions: In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until softened.
Add all-purpose flour and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Gradually add vegetable broth while stirring to avoid lumps. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and add corn kernels. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until corn is tender.
Using an immersion blender, blend the soup until smooth. Alternatively, let the soup cool slightly and blend it in batches in a blender.
Stir in milk and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

name: Indian Spiced Lentil Soup
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Sauté until onions are soft and translucent.
Add diced carrot and potato to the pot and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, garam masala, and cayenne pepper (if using). Cook for another 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add rinsed red lentils and chopped tomato to the pot. Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes, or until lentils and vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Adjust seasoning if necessary.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.

name: Chicken Manchow Soup
ingredients: 1/4 cup bell peppers (red, green, and yellow), finely chopped
1 tbsp cornstarch, dissolved in 2 tbsp water
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add finely chopped onion, minced garlic, grated ginger, and finely chopped green chili. Sauté until onions are soft and translucent.
Add finely chopped carrot, cabbage, and bell peppers to the pot. Cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in finely chopped boneless chicken and cook until chicken is no longer pink.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Add soy sauce, vinegar, chili sauce, and tomato ketchup to the pot. Mix well.
Slowly pour in beaten eggs while stirring the soup continuously to create egg strands.
Add the dissolved cornstarch mixture to the soup to thicken it. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Adjust seasoning if necessary.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.

name: Chicken Hot & Sour Soup
ingredients: 3-4 dried shiitake mushrooms, soaked in water for 30 minutes and thinly sliced
1/4 cup cornstarch, dissolved in 1/2 cup water
2 green onions, thinly sliced, for garnish
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add sliced chicken and cook until no longer pink. Remove chicken from the pot and set aside.
In the same pot, add sliced mushrooms, julienned carrot, bamboo shoots, and diced tofu. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, chili oil, and sugar to the pot. Mix well.
Slowly pour in beaten eggs while stirring the soup continuously to create egg strands.
Add the dissolved cornstarch mixture to the soup to thicken it. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Adjust seasoning if necessary.
Return cooked chicken to the pot and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with thinly sliced green onions and fresh cilantro leaves.

name: Chicken Bamboo Shoots Soup
ingredients: 2 green onions, thinly sliced, for garnish
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add thinly sliced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Sauté until onions are soft and translucent.
Add thinly sliced chicken to the pot and cook until no longer pink.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add bamboo shoots, mushrooms, and green peas to the pot. Simmer for another 10 minutes.
Stir in soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Adjust seasoning if necessary.
Serve hot, garnished with thinly sliced green onions.

name: Mutton Paya
ingredients: 1 kg mutton trotters (paya), cleaned and washed
instructions: Heat oil in a pressure cooker over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add grated ginger and minced garlic to the cooker. Sauté for another 2 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes and slit green chilies. Cook until tomatoes turn soft and oil starts to separate.
Add cleaned mutton trotters (paya) to the cooker. Mix well with the masala.
In a bowl, whisk yogurt with red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt. Add this yogurt mixture to the cooker and stir well.
Add enough water to cover the mutton trotters. Close the pressure cooker with its lid and cook for about 8-10 whistles or until the trotters are tender and cooked through.
Once the pressure releases, open the cooker and check the consistency of the gravy. If it's too thin, simmer uncovered until it thickens to your desired consistency.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with lemon wedges and naan or rice.

name: Mudha Pappu
ingredients: 1 cup toor dal (split pigeon peas), washed and soaked for 30 minutes
instructions: In a pressure cooker, add the soaked toor dal along with 3 cups of water. Pressure cook for about 4-5 whistles or until the dal is soft and cooked through. Set aside.
Heat ghee or oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, and a pinch of asafoetida. Sauté for a few seconds.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add grated ginger and minced garlic. Sauté for another 2-3 minutes until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes and slit green chilies. Cook until tomatoes turn mushy and oil starts to separate.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Now, add the cooked toor dal to the pan. Mix everything together and let it simmer for 5-10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice or roti.

name: Dal Tadka
ingredients: 1 cup yellow lentils (moong dal), washed and soaked for 30 minutes
instructions: In a pressure cooker, add the soaked yellow lentils along with 3 cups of water. Pressure cook for about 4-5 whistles or until the lentils are soft and cooked through. Set aside.
Heat ghee or oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add dried red chilies, curry leaves, and a pinch of asafoetida. Sauté for a few seconds.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add grated ginger and minced garlic. Sauté for another 2-3 minutes until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes and slit green chilies. Cook until tomatoes turn mushy and oil starts to separate.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Now, add the cooked yellow lentils to the pan. Mix everything together and let it simmer for 5-10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
For tadka (tempering), heat ghee in a small pan. Add cumin seeds and let them crackle.
Add dried red chilies and sauté for a few seconds.
Pour the tadka over the cooked dal and mix well.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice or roti.

name: Paneer Burji
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add finely chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
Add grated ginger, minced garlic, and finely chopped green chili. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until raw smell disappears.
Add finely chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add crumbled paneer and mix gently, ensuring the paneer is coated with the masala.
Cook for another 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the flavors blend well.
Sprinkle garam masala powder and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Serve hot with roti or paratha.

name: Guthi Vankaya
ingredients: 1/2 cup roasted peanuts, ground into a powder
instructions: Wash the brinjals and make a crosswise slit at the base, keeping them intact.

In a mixing bowl, combine ground peanuts, sesame seeds, desiccated coconut, chopped onion, chopped tomatoes, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well to form a stuffing mixture.
Stuff the prepared mixture into the slits of the brinjals and keep the remaining stuffing aside.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Place the stuffed brinjals in the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the remaining stuffing mixture to the pan and mix well.
Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes until the brinjals are tender and the stuffing is cooked.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Natukodi Pulusu
ingredients: 500g country chicken (natukodi), cleaned and cut into pieces
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add grated ginger and minced garlic to the pan. Sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes and slit green chilies to the pan. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and garam masala powder to the pan. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add the cleaned and cut country chicken (natukodi) pieces to the pan. Mix well to coat the chicken pieces with the masala.
Add salt to taste and mix again. Cover the pan and cook for 10-15 minutes until the chicken is partially cooked.
Add water as needed to adjust the consistency of the gravy. Cover and cook for another 15-20 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the gravy thickens.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Chicken Fry
ingredients: Handful of fresh coriander leaves, chopped
instructions: Marinate the chicken pieces with turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, ginger-garlic paste, yogurt, and salt. Mix well and let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
Add the slit green chilies and chopped tomatoes to the pan. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy.
Add the marinated chicken pieces to the pan. Stir well to coat the chicken pieces with the onion-tomato mixture.
Cover and cook the chicken for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
Once the chicken is cooked, remove the lid and increase the heat to medium-high. Fry the chicken pieces until they turn golden brown and crispy on the outside, stirring occasionally.
Once the chicken is fried to perfection, sprinkle freshly chopped coriander leaves and drizzle lemon juice over the chicken fry.
Serve hot as an appetizer or as a side dish with rice or roti.

name: Mutton Keema
ingredients: Handful of fresh coriander leaves, chopped
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add the ginger-garlic paste and green chilies to the pan. Sauté until the raw smell disappears.
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.
Add the minced mutton (keema) to the pan. Mix well with the onion-tomato mixture.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt to the pan. Stir to combine all the spices with the keema.
Cook the keema mixture for 15-20 minutes on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the mutton is cooked through and the mixture is dry.
Once the keema is cooked, add yogurt to the pan and mix well. Cook for another 5 minutes until the yogurt is well incorporated and the keema is cooked to perfection.
Garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

name: Mutton Pulusu
ingredients: Handful of fresh coriander leaves, chopped
instructions: Heat oil in a pressure cooker. Add chopped onions and green chilies. Saute until onions turn golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and saute until the raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add mutton pieces and saute for 5-7 minutes until the mutton changes color.
Add tamarind extract and water. Mix well.
Pressure cook for about 6-7 whistles or until the mutton is tender and cooked.
Once the pressure releases, open the cooker and check the consistency. If it's too thick, add more water.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and curry leaves.
Serve hot with steamed rice or roti.

name: Mushroom Pulao
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
Handful of fresh coriander leaves, chopped
instructions: Heat ghee or oil in a pressure cooker. Add cumin seeds, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick, and bay leaf. Saute until aromatic.
Add thinly sliced onions and saute until golden brown.
Add minced garlic, chopped ginger, and slit green chili. Saute for a minute.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook until they shrink and release water.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well.
Drain the soaked basmati rice and add it to the cooker. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add 2 cups of water and chopped coriander leaves. Mix well.
Pressure cook for 2 whistles on medium heat.
Once the pressure releases, open the cooker and fluff the pulao with a fork.
Serve hot with raita or any curry of your choice.

name: Paneer Pulao
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
Handful of fresh coriander leaves, chopped
instructions: Heat ghee or oil in a pressure cooker. Add cumin seeds, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick, and bay leaf. Saute until aromatic.
Add thinly sliced onions and saute until golden brown.
Add minced garlic, chopped ginger, and slit green chili. Saute for a minute.
Add cubed paneer and cook until lightly golden on the edges.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well.
Drain the soaked basmati rice and add it to the cooker. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add 2 cups of water and chopped coriander leaves. Mix well.
Pressure cook for 2 whistles on medium heat.
Once the pressure releases, open the cooker and fluff the pulao with a fork.
Serve hot with raita or any curry of your choice.

name: Vegetable Dum Biryani
ingredients: 1.5 cups basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas, cauliflower), chopped
1/4 tsp saffron strands, soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk
instructions: Heat ghee or oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add thinly sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnishing.
To the remaining onions in the pan, add chopped tomatoes, grated ginger, minced garlic, and slit green chilies. Saute until tomatoes turn soft and mushy.
Add chopped mixed vegetables and saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala powder, and garam masala powder. Mix well.
Add chopped mint leaves, chopped coriander leaves, and beaten yogurt. Mix everything well and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Drain the soaked basmati rice and add it to the pan. Gently mix the rice with the vegetable mixture.
Add 2 cups of water and salt to taste. Stir gently and bring it to a boil.
Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid and cook for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and all the water is absorbed.
While the biryani is cooking, soak saffron strands in warm milk and set aside.
Once the rice is cooked, turn off the heat. Drizzle the saffron-infused milk over the cooked rice.
Garnish the biryani with fried onions and cover the pan with a lid. Let it sit for another 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
Serve hot with raita or any curry of your choice.

name: Paneer Dum Biryani
ingredients: 1.5 cups basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
1/4 tsp saffron strands, soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk
instructions: Heat ghee or oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add thinly sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnishing.
To the remaining onions in the pan, add chopped tomatoes, grated ginger, minced garlic, and slit green chilies. Saute until tomatoes turn soft and mushy.
Add paneer cubes and saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala powder, and garam masala powder. Mix well.
Add chopped mint leaves, chopped coriander leaves, and beaten yogurt. Mix everything well and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Drain the soaked basmati rice and add it to the pan. Gently mix the rice with the paneer mixture.
Add 2 cups of water and salt to taste. Stir gently and bring it to a boil.
Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid and cook for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and all the water is absorbed.
While the biryani is cooking, soak saffron strands in warm milk and set aside.
Once the rice is cooked, turn off the heat. Drizzle the saffron-infused milk over the cooked rice.
Garnish the biryani with fried onions and cover the pan with a lid. Let it sit for another 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
Serve hot with raita or any curry of your choice.

name: Hyderabadi Chicken Dum Biryani
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
Saffron strands soaked in warm milk, for garnishing
instructions: Heat ghee or oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add thinly sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnishing.
To the remaining onions in the pan, add chopped tomatoes, grated ginger, minced garlic, and slit green chilies. Saute until tomatoes turn soft and mushy.
Add chicken pieces and saute for 5-7 minutes until they are slightly browned.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala powder, and garam masala powder. Mix well.
Add chopped mint leaves, chopped coriander leaves, and beaten yogurt. Mix everything well and cook for another 5 minutes.
Drain the soaked basmati rice and add it to the pan. Gently mix the rice with the chicken mixture.
Add 2 cups of water and salt to taste. Stir gently and bring it to a boil.
Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid and cook for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and all the water is absorbed.
While the biryani is cooking, soak saffron strands in warm milk and set aside.
Once the rice is cooked, turn off the heat. Drizzle the saffron-infused milk over the cooked rice.
Garnish the biryani with fried onions and cover the pan with a lid. Let it sit for another 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
Serve hot with raita or any curry of your choice.

name: Chettinad Chicken Pulao
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
Fried onions and chopped coriander leaves for garnishing
instructions: Heat ghee or oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add thinly sliced onions and saute until they turn golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnishing.
To the remaining onions in the pan, add fennel seeds and cumin seeds. Saute for a minute until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes, grated ginger, minced garlic, and slit green chilies. Cook until tomatoes become soft and mushy.
Add chicken pieces and cook for 5-7 minutes until they are slightly browned.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala powder. Mix well and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add chopped mint leaves, chopped coriander leaves, and beaten yogurt. Mix everything well and cook for another 5 minutes.
Drain the soaked basmati rice and add it to the pan. Gently mix the rice with the chicken mixture.
Add 2 cups of water and salt to taste. Stir gently and bring it to a boil.
Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid and cook for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and all the water is absorbed.
Once the rice is cooked, turn off the heat. Garnish the pulao with fried onions and chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with raita or any curry of your choice.

name: Spicy Mutton Pulao
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
Fried onions and chopped coriander leaves for garnishing
instructions: Heat ghee or oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add thinly sliced onions and saute until they turn golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnishing.
To the remaining onions in the pan, add fennel seeds and cumin seeds. Saute for a minute until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes, grated ginger, minced garlic, and slit green chilies. Cook until tomatoes become soft and mushy.
Add mutton pieces and cook for 10-12 minutes until they are slightly browned.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala powder. Mix well and cook for another 10 minutes.
Add chopped mint leaves, chopped coriander leaves, and beaten yogurt. Mix everything well and cook for another 10 minutes.
Drain the soaked basmati rice and add it to the pan. Gently mix the rice with the mutton mixture.
Add 2 cups of water and salt to taste. Stir gently and bring it to a boil.
Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid and cook for 30-35 minutes or until the rice is cooked and all the water is absorbed.
Once the rice is cooked, turn off the heat. Garnish the pulao with fried onions and chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with raita or any curry of your choice.

name: Mutton Keema Pulao
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes
Fried onions and chopped coriander leaves for garnishing
instructions: Heat ghee or oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, grated ginger, minced garlic, and chopped green chilies. Cook until tomatoes become soft and mushy.
Add mutton keema and cook until it changes color.
Add cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala powder. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes.
Add beaten yogurt, chopped mint leaves, and chopped coriander leaves. Mix everything well and cook for another 10 minutes.
Drain the soaked basmati rice and add it to the pan. Gently mix the rice with the mutton mixture.
Add 2 cups of water and salt to taste. Stir gently and bring it to a boil.
Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid and cook for 20-25 minutes or until the rice is cooked and all the water is absorbed.
Once the rice is cooked, turn off the heat. Garnish the pulao with fried onions and chopped coriander leaves.
Serve hot with raita or any curry of your choice.

name: Mutton Dum Biryani
ingredients: 4 cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes
Saffron strands soaked in warm milk
instructions: Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnishing.
To the remaining onions in the pan, add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Sauté until fragrant.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.
Now, add mutton pieces, red chili powder, turmeric powder, biryani masala, and salt. Mix well and cook until the mutton is partially cooked.
Add beaten yogurt, chopped mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Mix everything well and cook for another 10 minutes.
In a separate large pot, bring water to boil. Add soaked basmati rice along with salt and lemon juice. Cook the rice until it is 70% cooked. Drain the excess water and set aside.
Now, it's time to layer the biryani. In a heavy-bottomed pot, spread a layer of cooked mutton masala at the bottom.
Add a layer of partially cooked rice on top of the mutton masala.
Sprinkle some fried onions and chopped mint-coriander leaves on top of the rice.
Repeat the layers until all the mutton masala and rice are used up, ending with a layer of rice on top.
Drizzle saffron milk on the top layer of rice. Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid or seal it with dough to trap the steam.
Place the pot on a tawa (griddle) and cook on low heat for about 30-40 minutes or until the rice is fully cooked and the mutton is tender.
Once done, gently fluff up the biryani with a fork, mix the layers, and serve hot, garnished with fried onions.
Enjoy your delicious Mutton Dum Biryani with raita and salad!

name: Pina Colada
ingredients: Pineapple wedge and maraschino cherry for garnish
instructions: In a blender, combine white rum, pineapple juice, coconut cream, and crushed ice.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour the mixture into a chilled glass.
Garnish with a pineapple wedge and a maraschino cherry.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Pina Colada!

name: Screwdriver
ingredients: Orange slice and maraschino cherry for garnish
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes.
Pour vodka over the ice.
Top with orange juice and stir gently to combine.
Garnish with an orange slice and a maraschino cherry.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Screwdriver!

name: Mango Mojito
ingredients: 2 tablespoons white sugar, or to taste
Mango slices and mint sprigs for garnish
instructions: Place mint leaves and 1 lime wedge into a sturdy glass.
Use a muddler to crush the mint and lime to release the mint oils and lime juice.
Add 2 more lime wedges and the sugar, and muddle again to release the lime juice.
Do not strain the mixture.
Fill the glass almost to the top with ice.
Pour the rum over the ice, and fill the glass with club soda.
Stir, taste, and add more sugar if desired.
Add mango nectar, stirring well.
Garnish with mango slices and mint sprigs.
Serve and enjoy your refreshing Mango Mojito!

name: Virgin Mojito
ingredients: Mint sprig and lime slice for garnish
instructions: In a glass, muddle together lime wedges, fresh mint leaves, and sugar.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Top with club soda or sparkling water.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a slice of lime.
Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Virgin Mojito!
